flawed_nl_solution:
The frame she initially intended to buy was 1/5*$60=${<<1/5*60=300>>}300 more expensive than she had thought.
This means the frame was being sold at $60+$300 = ${<<60+300=360>>}360
If she paid for a smaller frame at 3/4 the price of the frame she initially intended to buy, she paid 3/4*$360 = ${<<3/4*360=270>>}270
Yvette remained with $60-$270 = ${<<60-270=-210>>}-210

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12, not 300. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
